forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog before noon. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. North wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 10pm. Mostly cloudy. Low around 51, with temperatures rising to around 53 overnight. South southeast wind 7 to 10 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a soft, muted light spills across the landscape, revealing a city embracing a gentle embrace of patchy fog. Early morning commuters will find the city draped in a veil of low clouds, lending a surreal quality to the urban scenery. The day promises to be partly sunny, though the cool air will keep temperatures around a rather crisp fifty-eight degrees, potentially dipping into the mid-fifties in the afternoon as the north wind whispers its way through the streets.

Tonight, the scene shifts dramatically, as rain heralds its arrival after ten. A thick layer of clouds will cloak the city, warm winds from the southeast hinting at the impending storm. As you prepare for the day ahead, layering becomes essential; a light sweater paired with a water-resistant jacket will serve well as the fog gradually yields to the promise of wet weather. Today is perfect for indoor pursuits; consider exploring one of the city's lesser-known museums, indulging in the rich tapestry of art and history, or sinking into a cozy café with a good book as raindrops begin to dance on the windowpanes.
